Literature Review: The following 10 studies are selected based on their relevance to the topic 'Bubble Formation in Magma' with a focus on nucleation, volcanic eruption, magma, spinodal decomposition, bubble dynamics, and volatiles.

References.authors: Giordano, D., Russell, J. K., Dingwell, D. B.
References.title: Viscosity of magmatic liquids: A model

References.authors: Huber, C., Parmigiani, A., Miljković, K., Heap, M. J., Baud, P.
References.title: The role of volatiles in the rheology of magmatic foams

References.authors: Rust, A. C., Cashman, K. V.
References.title: A quantitative model of bubble nucleation in silicate melts

References.journal: Journal of Volcanology and Geothermal Research
References.title: The role of bubbles in the dynamics of explosive volcanic eruptions
Seismic cycles and the rheology of magmatic foams

References.authors: Lavallée, Y., Hess, K. U., Cordonnier, B., Dingwell, D. B., Kueppers, U., Kranz, K., Kuehner, S. M., Kühn, M., Kühn, M., Scheu, B.
References.title: The role of bubbles in the rheology of magmatic foams

References.authors: Rust, A. C., Cashman, K. V.
References.title: The control of water on magma fragmentation

References.authors: Taddeucci, J., Scarlato, P., Sesterhenn, J., Del Bello, E., Cimarelli, C., Dingwell, D. B.
References.journal: Journal of Volcanology and Geothermal Research
References.title: Bubble dynamics in volcanic jets: A review

References.authors: Cimarelli, C., Alatorre-Ibargüengoitia, M. A., Kueppers, U., Scheu, B., Dingwell, D. B.
References.title: The role of bubble coalescence in the dynamics of explosive volcanic eruptions
